Dialogue Context: User: Who invented photography? Agent: Nic\u00e9phore Ni\u00e9pce, Henry Fox Talbot and Louis Daguerre are the inventors. User: When did color photography arrise? Agent: Do you want to know the time it was first attempted or the foundation method was proposed or the first photograph was made? User: Actually, what is the foundation method?
Response: The foundational method in which all practical color processes whether chemical or electronic is the three-color method.
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 1: The three-color method, which is the foundation of virtually all practical color processes whether chemical or electronic, was first suggested in an 1855 paper on color vision by Scottish physicist James Clerk Maxwell

Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 2: Because in the Northern Hemisphere Halloween comes in the wake of the yearly apple harvest, candy apples (known as toffee apples outside North America), caramel apples or taffy apples are common Halloween treats made by rolling whole apples in a sticky sugar syrup, sometimes followed by rolling them in nuts

Dialogue Context: User: What is the main cause of contemporary climate change? Agent: It is caused by the emission of greenhouse gases, mostly carbon dioxide (CO2) and methane. Are you looking for the sources of such greenhouse gases? User: I'm curious to know where methane can be found?
Response: Methane is produced either organically or by humans. Which base of production would you like to learn more of?
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 1: The most clearly identified rise in atmospheric methane as a result of human activity occurred in the 1700s during the industrial revolution
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 2: Any process that results in the production of methane and its release into the atmosphere can be considered a "source".

Dialogue Context: User: How did the Great Depression end in the United States?
Response: The Great Depression ended in the United States by 1941 thanks to defense spending and military mobilization by the government.
Evidence Page Title 1: Great Depression in the United States
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 1: By the end of 1941, before American entry into the war, defense spending and military mobilization had started one of the greatest booms in American history thus ending the last traces of unemployment

Dialogue Context: User: Are there any camping grounds or lodging possibilities in the Glacier National Park?
Response: There is a Glacier National Park present in the United States, and one in Canada. Which would you like to know more of?
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 1: Glacier National Park is an American national park located in northwestern Montana, on the Canada–United States border, adjacent to the Canadian provinces of Alberta and British Columbia
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 2: Glacier National Park is part of a system of 43 parks and park reserves across Canada, and one of seven national parks in British Columbia

User: What species are overfished in the Great Barrier Reef? Agent: Giant Triton and sharks are overfished. User: What do people dump in the water?
Response: A variety of human-made pollution is dumped into the reef including farming runoff and heavy metals. Which would like to learn more of?
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 1: Farming fertiliser runoff release nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium into the oceanic ecosystem, and these limiting nutrients cause massive algal growth which eventually leads to a reduction in oxygen available for other creatures in a process called eutrophication
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 2: Sediment runoff from farming carries chemicals into the reef environment also reduces the amount of light available to the corals decreasing their ability to extract energy from their environment
Evidence Paragraph First Sentence 3: Pesticides used in farming are made up of heavy metals such as lead, mercury, arsenic and other toxins are released into the wider environment due to erosion of farm soil, which has a detrimental effect on the coral
